issues.title: Clinical Issues Extraction
issues.description: Used to identify distinct clinical issues from the transcript
issues.prompt:
Please determine the significant clinical issues within this clinical scenario. 
Format each issue as a brief, clear statement.

Rules:
Each issue should be a single line
Maximum number of characters per issue is 60.
If two issues are associated, include them as a single line to avoid repetition.
Do not number the issues

Clinical scenario:
{{text}}

guidelines.title: Guidelines Selection
guidelines.description: Used to select relevant guidelines for each clinical issue
guidelines.prompt:
Please identify ONLY the guidelines that DIRECTLY address the management of this specific clinical issue. The guidelines must contain specific recommendations or protocols for managing this exact condition.

Rules:
- Select ONLY guidelines that have this issue as their primary focus
- EXCLUDE guidelines that only mention the issue in passing
- EXCLUDE guidelines that focus on different conditions
- Return ONLY the exact filenames of relevant guidelines
- List each filename on a new line
- Do not add any additional text or explanations

For example, for 'Previous Caesarean Section', ONLY return guidelines specifically about VBAC or birth after caesarean.
For 'Obesity in Pregnancy', ONLY return guidelines specifically about managing obesity in pregnancy.

Issue: {{text}}

Available guidelines:
{{guidelines}}

clinicalNote.title: Clinical Note Generation
clinicalNote.description: Used to generate the final clinical note
clinicalNote.prompt:
Please write a concise clinical note using medical terminology, based solely on the clinical transcript provided below. Do not invent or assume any details that are not explicitly mentioned in the transcript.

The output must follow this format:

Summary:
SUMMARY TEXT HERE

BODY TEXT HERE

Plan:
PLAN TEXT HERE

Rules:
- Use professional medical terminology.
- Use one sentence per line.
- The 'summary:' section should provide a brief overview of the key points.
- The 'body:' section should detail the clinical findings and any concerns.
- The 'plan:' section should list management steps and follow-up instructions, each on a new line.
- Only include details that are directly mentioned in the transcript (do not add age, BMI, parity, or any other information if not provided).

Clinical transcript:
{{text}}

applyGuideline.title: Apply Guideline to Clinical Situation
applyGuideline.description: Used to apply a clinical guideline to a specific clinical situation
applyGuideline.prompt:
I would like you to apply the attached clinical guideline to the following clinical situation.

Your response should include the following, where appropriate:
1. Further information needed - list what additional information is needed and why
2. Proposed management according to the guideline
3. Benefits of the proposed approach
4. Risks of the proposed approach
5. Alternative approaches

Guideline:
{{guideline}}

Clinical situation:
{{situation}}
